newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam's Haiphong airport open again after revamp.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam's Haiphong airport open again after revamp.

text.p: The airport at Vietnam's northern port city of Haiphong has reopened after more than a year of repairs and upgrading, official media reports said on Tuesday.
The Vietnam News Agency said plans were now being considered for a revamp of the road linking Cat Bi airport to Haiphong, the country's third city.
Cat Bi airport is now able to handle Boeing 737-300 aircraft, of which flag carrier Vietnam Airlines has taken three deliveries this year.

Vietnam Airlines carried about 1.34 million passengers on domestic routes in 1995, a rise of 35.4 percent from the year before. Growth has been even more rapid since then, with 1.7 million passengers in just the first eight months of 1996.
